conbody.p: Euca2ools 3.3.0 resolves issues listed in the following table.

row.entry: Add support for eu-central-1 region, which covers AWS's new Frankfurt-based region.

Implement *LB-attributes for ELB.
The eulb-describe-load-balancer-attributes and eulb-modify-lb-attributes commands provide the ability to inspect and modify load balancers' attributes.

eulb-create-policy need to support a ton of attributes.
The eulb-create-lb-policy command gained a -A option that simplifies entering multiple attributes.

Make certificate and private key options to bundle commands optional, eliminating the need for the zip files to be produced by Eucalyptus's deprecated euca_conf --get-credentials command.
Images bundled without signing certificates are incompatible with Eucalyptus 4.1 and earlier and cannot be unbundled without cloud administrator assistance. Commands that bundle images no longer require signing certificates to run and can fetch the cloud's signing certificate automatically.
If the commands have been configured with the bootstrap service's endpoint and the cloud runs Eucalyptus or later. Normal users require the euserv:DescribeServiceCertificates capability in their IAM policies to use this functionality.
Default Euca2ools localhost config doesn't contain CloudFormation URL.
Differences in digest zero-padding can cause euca-unbundle to fail. euca-unbundle and euca-download-and-unbundle mistakenly treated some non-corrupt bundles as corrupt.
